part2.question: Describe an occasion when many people laughed together.
part2.model_answer: I vividly recall a school talent show last year where a student told some Hilarious [极滑稽的] jokes. The whole auditorium was filled with laughter. Since his performance was so Amusing [有趣的], everyone Burst into laughter [突然大笑] at the same time, although the teachers tried to stay serious. It was a Joyful [快乐的] moment that brought us all together. The laughter was truly Contagious [有感染力的]. Even the shy students were smiling. It was a Memorable [难忘的] event. I didn't feel Awkward [尴尬的] at all. It was a great way to relieve stress. I will never forget that day.

part2.question: Describe a time you saw someone show their feelings very openly.
part2.model_answer: I remember seeing my best friend cry with joy when she won a competition. She was incredibly Expressive [表现力丰富的] and couldn't hide her emotions. Because she tends to be open, everyone knew exactly how happy she was, which was touching to see. It wasn't Awkward [尴尬的], but beautiful. Her happiness was Contagious [有感染力的] to the crowd. She didn't care about Suppression [压抑] of her tears. It was a Captivating [迷人的] moment of truth. She is usually very Amusing [有趣的] too. It showed her human side. It was a special day for her. I was very proud of her achievement.

part2.question: Describe a comedy movie or live performance that made you laugh.
part2.model_answer: I really enjoyed watching a stand-up comedy show by a local comedian who is known for being Hilarious [极滑稽的]. He knew how to Crack a joke [讲笑话] about everyday life perfectly. Although some jokes were silly, I couldn't stop laughing, because his delivery was so good. It was the most Amusing [有趣的] hour I have spent in a long time. His Sense of humor [幽默感] is unique. The show was Captivating [迷人的] from start to finish. I Burst into laughter [突然大笑] many times. It was a Joyful [快乐的] evening. Laughter is the best medicine [笑是最好的良药] indeed for stress relief.

part3.question: Why do people laugh in their daily lives?
part3.model_answer: [Opinion] To be honest, it is a natural stress reliever for most people. [Reason] As the saying goes, laughter helps us cope with difficulties and bad days effectively by releasing endorphins. [Example] When we laugh, we release tension and feel Joyful [快乐的] instantly. It is vital for Psychological [心理的] health and Bonding [建立纽带] with our close friends and family members.

part3.question: Why do people smile when they take photos? Is it a genuine smile or a fake one?
part3.model_answer: [Opinion] Often, it is a social expectation rather than real feeling. [Reason] People want to look happy in pictures, leading to Suppression [压抑] of true sadness or boredom for the sake of the image. [Example] Unless they are truly having fun, the smile is just a mask for the camera. It is hard to Keep a straight face [板着脸] if you are sad.

part3.question: Should we express our emotions immediately or hide them?
part3.model_answer: [Opinion] In my view, balance is the key to healthy relationships. [Reason] While being Expressive [表现力丰富的] is healthy, sometimes we must control ourselves in public spaces to avoid unnecessary conflict. [Example] If you Wear one's heart on one's sleeve [情感外露] too much at work, it might be unprofessional. We need Literacy [素养] in emotions to handle conflict appropriately.

part3.question: Regarding showing emotions, are there any differences between women and men?
part3.model_answer: [Opinion] Generally speaking, women are encouraged to be more open socially. [Reason] Society often tells men to practice Suppression [压抑] of tears to look strong and manly, which can be harmful emotionally. [Example] Whereas women share feelings, men might hide them deep inside. However, this Universal [普遍的] stereotype is changing slowly in modern times because men are becoming more open.

part3.question: Is humor an essential tool for effective leadership in the workplace?
part3.model_answer: [Opinion] Absolutely [绝对地], it builds Bonding [建立纽带] within the team effectively. [Reason] A leader with a Sense of humor [幽默感] makes the environment less stressful for employees to work in, fostering better collaboration. [Example] Provided that the jokes are appropriate, it improves morale significantly. It improves Accessibility [可接近性] for everyone in the office and makes the manager seem more human.

part3.question: How does cultural background influence what people find funny?
part3.model_answer: [Opinion] It is evident that humor is not always Universal [普遍的]. [Reason] Jokes often depend on language play or local history that foreigners miss completely, leading to awkward silence instead of laughter. [Example] Although slapstick works everywhere, wordplay requires native Literacy [素养] levels. It is complex to translate jokes across different languages and cultures successfully.
